doc.field: The Kuwaiti government and private sector will study investments in Egyptian projects worth more than four billion dlrs, said the deputy-director for Egypt's Public Authority for Investment, Mohye al-Deen Gharib. The chairman of the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry, Abdul-Aziz al-Saqr, said the visitors had submitted 40 proposals for study. These included "economic, industrial and real estate projects, in addition to the investment field," he said, adding that a holding company may be established to oversee investments. REUTER
